definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

lit. you plant a garden and the flowers do not bloom, you poke a stick in the mud and it grows into a tree/fig. things do not always turn out as one would expect/well-laid plans may fail, and success may come where you least expect it
pinyin: you3 yi4 zai1 hua1 hua1 bu4 fa1 , wu2 xin1 cha1 liu3 liu3 cheng2 yin1
containing_words.word: 有意栽花花不发，无心插柳柳成阴

definition: to make sense/to have meaning/to have significance/meaningful/significant/worthwhile/important/interesting
lit. the falling flowers are yearning for love, but the heartless brook ripples on (idiom)/fig. one side is willing, yet the other one remains indifferent (usually of unrequited love)
pinyin: luo4 hua1 you3 yi4 , liu2 shui3 wu2 qing2

definition: The road means more than the destination./It is better to travel hopefully than to arrive.
pinyin: lu4 shang5 bi3 zhong1 dian3 geng4 you3 yi4 yi4

sentences.english: "Well, it isn't as interesting, " said Hurstwood.
sentences.chinese: “哎，也不如芝加哥有意思，”赫斯渥说。

sentences.english: You feel you have something more to live for.
sentences.chinese: 你感觉生活变得更有意义和丰富多彩。

sentences.english: Mary intended to acknowledge him as her son.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽有意认他做自己的儿子。

sentences.english: The social effect of an evening of one-on-one theatre is interesting.
sentences.chinese: 这一夜一对一剧场的社会反响很有意思。

sentences.english: It was a very interesting project. I really enjoyed working on it.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目很有意思，我很喜欢干。

sentences.english: This small window of consciousness was renowned as the best time for boning.
sentences.chinese: 这种1小时的有意识状态被认为是最佳的适应时间。

sentences.english: Seeing her former husband, she stood aside consciously.
sentences.chinese: 一看到她的前夫，她有意避开了。

sentences.english: To learn about the Wolong Panda Reserve was really interesting.
sentences.chinese: 了解到卧龙熊猫保护区的情况真有意思。

sentences.english: In the stream were the flowers flowing.
“There’s no question that Dr. Kearns’ wiper circuit was interesting, ” Daykin says.
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问，卡恩斯博士的雨刷电路是非常有意思的。

sentences.english: We got to train with Ole Gunnar Solskjaer and that was really fun and he was really friendly.
sentences.chinese: 我们在索尔斯克亚的指导下训练，这很有意思。

sentences.english: The professor is really hilarious and funny. He makes it very interesting.
sentences.chinese: 教授真的很搞笑很滑稽，他课讲很有意思。

sentences.english: because I put myself in a position to meet a lot more interesting people in LA.
sentences.chinese: 因为当时我想接触那些有意思的人。

sentences.english: The poor pauper paused on purpose to pawn a porpoise.
sentences.chinese: 贫穷的乞丐有意停下来典当一只海豚。

sentences.english: Subsequent books would stress that the nebulous existence of the organization was entirely by design.
sentences.chinese: 后来的书强调这个组织的时有时无完全是有意为之。

sentences.english: Interesting is the letter writing that they had to do.
sentences.chinese: 最有意思的是书信写作。

definition: inadvertent/accidental/to have no intention of (doing sth)
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
to have a mind to/to intend to/deliberately/considerate
to discuss a matter with sb/to get in touch with/to arrange
